comments.commentBody: You admire strong women in the movies?  You are a comedy writer.
The word "reptilian" comes to mind.
She's a comedy writer. She was kidding.
No, she is just an opportunist. An incredibly incompetent CEO, but a great opportunist.

Child care does not "allow men and women to be human."

Many women with children cannot "do what men are doing" without dependable and affordable child care. Well, maybe they could if the children's father could stay at home, or if the mother and father could stay at home on alternating, coordinated, and dependable schedules. But the workplace would need to accommodate that, and it generally doesn't. If the children's grandparents were in a position to help out, that would be great, but grandma and grandpa often live far away.

We live in society, so it is social policies that enable us to do many things that we want to do.

I am no fan of her. In fact, given the state of politics, I am no fan of any politician -- man or woman. It is fair to say feminism is a political movement. A political movement for what? If it is for women to what do what men are doing, she is a feminist. If it is for childcare and job protections that allow men and women to be human, then it is like asking her to be a social democrat. She is not a social democrat.

No just empathy, high moral and ethical standards, a sense of fair play and responsibility to those who you are entrusted to protect and serve or in other words the same as we expect from men. Carly possesses none of the above.

Am i the only one who's even troubled that there is even "room for debate" about this?  Of course Carly Fiorina is not a feminist. The implication is that any competent, strong, unflappable woman who can acquit herself well in a male dominated milieu, esp. one as publicly visible as presidential politics,  is worthy of the feminist moniker.  Nonsense!  I can think of a lot of complimentary things to say about Ms Fiorina: Brilliant.  Eloquent.  A great role model.  By my politics and philosophy, I can think of another:  A missed opportunity.  But to try to use her works and her deeds and her vision and her proscriptions for advancing the country as evidence of her feminist roots does great injustice to the many men and women who have fought so hard and given up so much for women's equality.
Totally agree. Where's Camille Pagilia?

While my comment almost certainly won't be posted, I feel compelled to write anyway.

The Times, as usual, arranges a "debate" with one debating team of four and the other a single token conservative. Like many of the commenters, the Times' assumption is that, by definition, you can't be a feminist (or black, for that matter) and be a Republican. In fact, since "people like us" are always Democrats, why even bother with this charade of a "debate." Isn't there some female equivalent of Charles Blow available at the moment whose job it is to police women who don't two the line? (I'm sure that Maureen Dowd is putting together some Carly "inner dialogue" to make this point.) That would probably be preferable to concocting a so-called debate to make the same point. The Times Op-Ed page more and more resembles the content of Salon or the Daily Kos. Sad for the self-proclaimed "newspaper of record."

Southern: demanding equal pay for equal work is hardly a new concept.

If there are 100s of women making more than you and you are doing the same job as them, time for you to become a feminist and speak up for yourself.

I think it entirely depends on your definition of feminism. If your definition includes actively seeking to promote policies that are supportive of other women and women's rights, then she is not a feminist. If you think feminism is forging your own path in a man's world and inspiring other women with the same ambitions, then I guess you could call her a feminist, although I'd opt for "role model". As a female, I'm less concerned about her status where feminism is concerned than what I perceive to be deep flaws in her character that in my view eliminate her from consideration as a viable candidate for any political office.
I am afraid your well thought out commentary will fall on blind eyes and deaf ears.
No gun law would have prevented this guy from getting a gun and killing. Gun controls do not stop anyone from acquiring an illegal weapon.
What new laws would you like to see adopted, and how would those new laws have prevented this senseless tragedy?

To the U.S. Congress and all state legislatures: Please stop holding up sensible gun laws for the sake of money. We know the gun lobby is powerful, we know they have donated a lot of money to many campaigns, we know they provide some jobs in manufacturing and sales. We know that easy access to guns is killing far, far too many people. We know that many of those people are children or young adults. We know that we have had enough if the senseless un-ending violence. Please stop the bickering and the entrenched posturing and solve this problem. Serve the people, protect the people, as you have sworn to do. We are tired of being frightened to leave our homes, or scared to send our children to school. This is not what being a free American is about.
I think the criteria is more about not throwing women under the bus to get yourself ahead for the Tea Party vote. Pretty simple.

OK, so 400,000 would be 28,571 each and every year.  Don't you think we would have heard about that before your report now?  Well, so much for gun-free zones.  Did those guns jump up from a table and start shooting on their own?  Get real People.  Go after the nuts that should be identified and locked up.
Since 9/11 less than 50 Americans have been killed by foreign inspired terrorists. Since 9/11 more than 400,000 Americans have died from firearms. Our Congress is a bunch of craven cowards.

How can a woman possibly call herself a feminist if she opposes the very policies that allow a woman to be a successful professional, mother, etc? This is totally contradictory to me. Bravo, Donna Brazile.

Thank you, Stephanie Coontz, for expressing my feelings exactly. It is very hard to embrace Fiorina's opinions on Planned Parenthood, especially when she refused on the Sunday talk shows to even acknowledge that the videos were doctored in any way. It was very disconcerting. I appreciate your putting feminism in the appropriate historical, political, and social context.

Donna Brazile is as we are accustomed to expect, tempered and thoughtful.  I respect her enormously for this.  However, it is time to put aside our well-intentioned and well-bred tendencies for some hard truths:  Carly Fiorina is running on an agenda that seeks to not just put aside but destroy well-earned rights for women to determine their destinies. Nothing can convince me to support a woman who is willing to give up 100+ years of hear-earned rights for the sake of...what?  An office?  Seriously???

I share your outrage, but what law would prevent this? Background checks? Not likely. Saying something has to be done isn't enough, we need to know what will work.  I've investigated gun violence and mass shootings and very few if any would have been prevented by background checks. So what's left?

Your statement about shooting 'christians' has not been reported anywhere in any of the media in Oregon - it was stated in a piece on the NY Post. As an Oregonian - we get the facts pretty fast here. That is not even reported in the Roseburg News. How about you just chill out and wait for the facts. If its a hate crime the facts will come out.

koinonia, the citizens of the UK and Australia -- and, frankly, the rest of the developed world -- don't seem very afraid of their governments, even without US-style home arsenals.  Besides, armed citizens could not hope to prevail against tanks and cannons and really big military weapons.  Your argument doesn't stand up.

Now this is great tech support. I sent a note to the app I use on my Kindle for the crossword and got this answer the same day. The software is Crosswords Plus. It works on any Android device. I also use it on my Samsung phone.
_____________________

From: steve (Support staff)

My apologies Mac Knight,
I will free up the next month a day earlier.
Steve

On Thu, Oct 01 at 05:57 PM, William M. Knight wrote:

Device: KFAPWI
Android OS: 19
APP: com.standalone.Crosswords
version: 2.3.7.1

I solve the NYT crossword each evening after the puzzle for the next day comes out. Since I solve the day before, I use the "Download from archives" menu option to select tomorrow's date.

On the last day of each month, I need to download the puzzle for the first day of the next month. Download from archives will not allow me to move to the next month until that date arrives. I have to use other software for my puzzle on the last day of each month if I want to solve tomorrow's puzzle the night before.

Thanks.

Mac Knight

Is she a feminist? The fact that we judge her according to THAT standard at all says something about us as a culture--tho I can't figure out whether it's because we've evolved beyond judging women against men, or whether we've abdicated reasoned judgement at all.

Ignoring gender, liberals would react in horror and disgust over anyone with such an atrocious prior record of decision-making claiming the ability to lead the nation. Because she's a woman, we want to take her seriously and cut her absurd amounts of slack. We'll have won the gender wars when we stop either denigrating or inflating performance based on the gender of the person responsible. She has an atrocious record in any model I can determine. As such, she's an atrocious potential leader. End of story. We don't need another benighted leader forming policy. The fact that she's a woman doesn't grant her immunity from an honest critique of her supposed "accomplishments" and the destructive consequence of them. The "feminist" discussion is just a way to shield women from honest assessment. Why not quit it and enter a more enlightened 21st century.

Step 3 says to add the squash to the Mac and half the cheese sauce. "If it seems too dry, add the rest of the cheese sauce."  That's another three and a half cups of   cheese sauce!  Might you not need it? That seems like a lot of extra cheese sauce to either use or not!

Wow! What a doozy.
Both too much like a two-term president to actually be president?!

I put Fiorina in the same category as Jeb Bush. They are both too much like GW Bush to succeed as President. Carly is basing her candidacy on fear. She's also doing a pretty good acting job for a drama series or movie. I think she will end up in Hollywood. Like GW Bush she is a failed CEO. Remember GWBUSH failed at everything he was put in,charge of, including the POTUS. She is not to be taken seriously as a  Presidential candidate. I'm ashamed for her.

Even if the Founders had actually intended the 2nd Amendment to allow private gun ownership not associated with organized militias (which they didn't), it is high time to repeal this piece of cancer in our nation's governmental DNA.

Hello? This guy just marched his guns right into a gun-free zone in blatant violation of that law. He then started shooting people in violation of THAT law. What on earth makes you think that he's going to start obeying the law that says, what exactly? What are you asking for? No guns? Guns are effectively banned in Mexico but *somehow* people get them. Guns are not going to be banned here, at most only more limited. But clearly the people who go and do these ILLEGAL shootings don't mind breaking the law.

What you do notice is that these shooting happen in gun-free zones. Hello! Perhaps we'd have better luck by banning gun-free zones...

Peter, I own several personal firearms. I am 64 years of age and have not been issued a traffic citation in 40 years, I am as clean as the wind-driven snow. I will keep my personal firearms to protect myself and my family. I am sorry that you disagree that I should be in possession of a self defense weapon, but I will never relent to the likes of yourself. I will at all times retain the ability to protect my family.

REPEAL THE 2ND! Another citizen who has lived in the USA for 23 years (prior to that I lived in Australia). After raising two daughters here in beautiful SF bay area and looking at all the USA has to offer,I still cannot reconcile the idea that we all need a personal firearm. I live in fear that my two beautiful daughters will one day be a victim for no other reason than being in the wrong place at the wrong time.
AMERICA LISTEN UP!! THE ONLY WAY to change this ridiculous mindset is for all of us to make a stand and seek to repeal the 2nd Amendment of the US Constitution. I know that is a long term goal but until we remove that fall back position (that is "it is in the constitution") for all the politicians and commentators to claim their hands are tied, then we are blowing in the wind. The USA defeated slavery, they even banned booze for a short time, it can definitely change one of the amendments to the Constitution. Lets get real about what is required and give people control of their communities. If for nothing else lets do it for our children and their children.
